title: Carol Twombly
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030173507/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030173507/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers) : Carol Twombly**

Carol Twombly (1959-) studied architecture at the [Rhode Island School of Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030173507/http:/typophile.com/wiki/RISD), and went on to become one of the five students to get master's degrees in type design from [Charles Bigelow](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030173507/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Charles%20Bigelow) at Stanford. Twombly briefly worked for Bigelow as well. Her typeface [Mirarae](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030173507/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=BT.6414.0.0) won the Morisawa type design competition, and was produced by Bitstream. She worked for [Adobe Systems](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030173507/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Adobe%20Systems) from 1988-99, producing many well-known typefaces, including [Lithos](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030173507/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=LH.398.0.0), [Trajan](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030173507/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=LH.108134.0.0), and [Adobe Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030173507/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_180.html). She retired from type design and left Adobe in 1999 to do other crafts, such as textile-based design and jewellery.
